prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. Daniel has exactly $20$ pieces of candy. He has to divide them equally among his $3$ sisters. What is the least number of pieces he should take away so that he could distribute the candy equally?
solution: When you divide $20$ by $3$, you get $6$ with a remainder of $2$. Therefore, he should take away $\boxed{2 \text{ pieces}}$ so he could give each of his sisters $6$ pieces.
gpt_response: To share the candy equally with his sisters, Daniel needs to make sure he has the same amount of candy left over after he gives some to each of them. Since $20$ can't be divided equally into $3$ parts, Daniel should take away $2$ pieces of candy so that he can share the remaining $18$ pieces equally among his $3$ sisters.
